intro: Utricularia subsimilis, commonly known as the Indian bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its tiny, bladder-like traps that capture microscopic organisms, enabling it to thrive in nutrient-poor water environments. This species is typically found in freshwater habitats such as ponds, ditches, and slow-moving streams. Its leaves are usually submerged, while its flowering stems emerge above the water surface. Utricularia subsimilis plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by controlling populations of small invertebrates and contributing to nutrient cycling.
